page.title: 03WHITWORTH DOCTORS
page.content: The town of Whitworth built up around the stone quarries and later the wool and cotton mills. Of its population {probably its most famous citizens}were the "{DOCTORS OF WHITWORTH}". These were a family called{TAYLOR}who settled in Whitworth in the{18th. {century.}It all started with JOHN TAYLOR who was an itinerant Blacksmith who practised his trade on either side of the Pennines. In a time of ill health he settled in Whitworth and he became known locally as a skilled man and one with a very considerable sympathy for animals. His "{doctoring}" began when he built a tin case to heal the broken leg of a cat. The leg healed well and his reputation quickly spread. Very soon he was dealing with humans. He was joined by his brothers and they {treated patients from}all{over England
